Description:
Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific - ProcessCreation
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((command like '%bypass%' and command like '%-noprofile%' and command like '%-windowstyle%' and command like '%hidden%' and command like '%new-object%' and command like '%system.net.webclient%' and command like '%.download%') or (command like '%iex%' and command like '%new-object%' and command like '%net.webclient%' and command like '%.download%') or (command like '%-nop%' and command like '% -w %' and command like '%hidden%' and command like '% -c %' and command like '%[convert]::frombase64string%') or (command like '% -w %' and command like '%hidden%' and command like '%-noni%' and command like '%-nop%' and command like '% -c %' and command like '%iex%' and command like '%new-object%') or (command like '% -w %' and command like '%hidden%' and command like '%-ep%' and command like '%bypass%' and command like '%-enc%') or (command like '%powershell%' and command like '%reg%' and command like '%add%' and command like '%\software\%')) and  not (command like '%(new-object system.net.webclient).downloadstring('https://community.chocolatey.org/install.ps1%' or command like '%write-chocolateywarning%'))
